Recap: Harley refuses to give up hope that Gus will come home even though all the evidence points to his death. Mallet tells Harley how much he loves her and gives her a kiss but Harley makes it Clear she loves Gus and is married to him. Ava sees Lizzie kissing Quinn outside Company but will she tell Coop about it? Josh and Olivia have a great time on their date. Jonathan shows up at Cassie's door with the file on Jeffrey he stole from Josh.
Transcript: ( cell phone ringing )
Jonathan: Hey. Did you get back to Reva's yet?
Tammy: Actually, I'm downtown. Marina wanted me to meet her for hot chocolate.
Jonathan: Damn. You guys really know how to tear it up.
Tammy: We'll go light on the marshmallows. Anyway, I think I have to go to the Beacon. I'm pretty sure I left my scarf there.
Jonathan: I can get it.
Tammy: What if my mom and Jeffrey are still there?
Jonathan: I wouldn't worry about that.
Tammy: Jonathan?
Jonathan: Yeah.
Tammy: I had a really good time tonight. It was so amazing to just be out in the world with you even if...
Jonathan: I know.
Tammy: I love you.
Jonathan: I love you, too, Tammy.
Lizzie: So, are you and Sandy back together?
Tammy: Eavesdrop much?
Lizzie: No, I was actually just looking for Coop, but I couldn't help but be distracted by the huge grin on your face. That means Ava's out of the picture, huh?
Tammy: Oh. It wasn't Sandy.
Lizzie: Well, who was it?
Tammy: Jonathan.
Lizzie: Jonathan's your cousin.
Tammy: Yeah.
Lizzie: Ew! Ew! I mean, oh!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: There you go.
Olivia: Thank you.
Josh: No, thank you. This is nice.
Olivia: It is nice. And it's a date?
Josh: Yes, it's a date. You want me to draw you a diagram of a date?
Olivia: No, no, no. It's okay, no. It's just that, you know, a little advance warning next time might be nice.
Josh: What's wrong with a little spontaneity?
Olivia: Absolutely nothing. It's just that, you know, a girl likes a little time to make herself presentable.

Josh: Yeah, it's funny you say that. I was just thinking how you don't look presentable at all right now. You look, you know, beautiful, and I know you're smart and sexy and all those things, but you know presentable.
Olivia: So you're okay with this. You're okay with our date?
Josh: Yes, ma'am. I am most definitely okay with our date.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Mallet: I don't know what that's like? I don't know what that feels like to walk around half alive, because you need somebody so bad that you're numb and you want them and you need them? And you just want to breathe them in, but you can't because you're numb and you're shut down. You've got so much pain inside of you, you're just afraid you're going split open and you're not even going to make it until tomorrow. I don't know what that's like? I don't know what that feels like? I do, because that's how I feel about you, okay?
Harley: You don't mean that.
Mallet: I do mean that. And I'm sorry you don't want to hear that.
Harley: I don't. Just keep it to yourself.
Mallet: I would do anything for you. Do you understand that?
Harley: Because we're friends. Because we're really good friends.
Mallet: Yeah, sure.
Harley: Don't say anything else, Mallet.

Mallet: You know what I'm saying. And don't pretend like you don't know what I'm saying. And don't act like I don't know what it feels like to lose somebody. And don't act like I don't know what it feels like to get lost because of that.
Harley: We're looking for my husband...
Mallet: Yeah, I know that. I know that. But everything inside of me just wants to take you inside my arms. I just want to make it better. That's all. I think I could make it better.
Harley: I love Gus.
Mallet: That's not what this is about.
Harley: I can't do this. I can't do this. Listen to me when I say this. There is no you and me here, okay? I am married.
Mallet: Yeah, I know that. I know that. But where is this guy? Where's this great guy that had everything and threw it away?
Harley: He was trying to protect me; that's what this was.
Mallet: Is that working out for you? How is that working out?
Harley: Why are you doing this? Why? Why now? Why are we doing this now?
Mallet: Because I hate seeing you in so much pain.
Harley: I'll be better once...
Frank: Sis?
Harley: ...We find Gus.
Mallet: Frank.
Frank: What's the matter?
Harley: No, it's okay. I...
Frank: You hurt your leg? How did you hurt your leg?
Harley: It's fine. I fell. It's fine. It doesn't matter.
Frank: Ed, this is my sister, Harley Cooper.
Ed: Miss Cooper.
Harley: It's Aitoro. I'm Mrs. Aitoro. Who are you?
Ed: Agent Fox, Federal Bureau of Investigation.
Harley: Thank God. The F.B.I. Finally. I want to get you guys up to speed on this.
Frank: No, no, you can't go. He actually needs to check out the car on his own.

Harley: Okay. I was just going to show him, that's all. They found this guy who had all of Gus's stuff on him, and he made up this stupid story about how he found Gus and Alan in the limousine, and they were...
Frank: I know, sis, I heard.

Harley: Don't look at me. Like that. He is not dead, okay? Gus is not dead. We're going to check out the car again, and then we're going to talking about canvassing the area and sending out search teams. Because we've got to find these guys, because it's only getting colder out there. And if they get caught in the snow, Frank... what is this guy's name, Fox? Fox.
Frank: This is agent Fox's investigation. He's got a lot of questions for you. You cannot be a part of this, sis. That's why they need you out of here now.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Coop: Your room is ready if you want to take a look.
Ava: You cleaned the room for me?
Coop: Don't get crazy, okay? I just happened to straighten...
Ava: Whatever. That was so sweet. Thank you.
Coop: It's all part of the job. I will say, though, that it is a little bit bare.
Ava: What do you mean by that?
Coop: There's no lamp in there, and there's no side table next to the bed. But I do have a box downstairs full of all sorts of old stuff that you can go through if you want to later on.
Ava: Sure, I would love that. But why is everything downstairs?
Coop: Well, Lizzie didn't like it, for one thing. All of the rooms were a little too eclectic for her. Anyways, look, how about I help you with your things?
Ava: Oh, no, thanks. I just have those two bags by the door and a box of books in the car.
Coop: That's it?
Ava: Yeah. I'm low maintenance.

Coop: Yeah? No kidding. No kidding. I remember Lizzie had so many shoes it could fill up an entire room. I even remember how she had the boxes labeled. It was like evening shoes in one box, and another box said "casual evening shoes." And a third box even said "casual evening event shoes." It was crazy.
Ava: Is your dad okay?
Coop: I don't know. I'll find out. Pops, who was that?
Buzz: Nobody.
Coop: Yeah, right. Was that about Gus?
Buzz: They found Alan's limo wrecked. Frank's there.
Coop: Are Gus and Alan...
Buzz: No, they weren't in it.
Coop: What happened?
Buzz: Nobody knows.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: I'm Gus's wife. I used to be a cop.
Frank: Two very good reasons for you not to be here. Sis, you're too close to this.
Harley: I can help them.
Frank: You are way too close to this. Let him do his job.

Marina: Lizzie, Tammy knows what she's doing.
Tammy: That's okay. I've heard it all before. Just say what you think, Lizzie.
Lizzie: No. Evidently it doesn't matter.
Tammy: Well, no, it doesn't. But, hey, I can take the brutal honesty, so come on, hit me.
Marina: You know, Tammy, I think Lizzie was just surprised before. Right?
Lizzie: Tammy and Jonathan are cousins.
Tammy: Thank you. I almost forgot.
Marina: Who cares?

Lizzie: How about the fact that it's gross?
Tammy: Interesting. Aren't you the person that told me if I liked Jonathan to go for it?
Lizzie: Yeah, I told you not to abandon him as a friend, but not fall in love with him.
Marina: I'm sorry, Lizzie, what exactly was your purpose here? I mean, besides to pass judgement.
Lizzie: I was looking for Coop.
Marina: Well, Coop's over at Company helping Ava get settled.
Lizzie: Oh.
Marina: So if you don't mind...
Lizzie: Yeah, sure.
Tammy: No, it's okay. I don't care what people think anymore. I don't.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: This is nice.
Olivia: This is good, isn't it?
Josh: Should we get a bottle, do you think?
Olivia: Oh, most definitely. But maybe we should order something to eat.
Josh: We can do that if we want because we have all night.
Olivia: We do?
Josh: Yeah.
Olivia: Great.
Josh: You know, it's been a long time since I've been out for a night of fun.
Olivia: You and me both.
Josh: In fact, it's been a long time since I've had any fun of any kind.
Olivia: Oh. It must have been hard to tell the kids about you and Reva?
Josh: Yes, it was. And there's this thing going on with Cassie, too.
Olivia: I thought you were going to let that go because she is happy.
Josh: Yeah, but I can't help but feel that that is going to end.
Olivia: Why would it end, Josh?
Josh: Because it's built on a lie. You and I both know how lies can destroy a relationship, right?
Olivia: Yeah. I thought we were both talking about Jeffrey and Cassie.
Josh: Sorry.
Olivia: No, because you are right, absolutely right. But, still, I thought you were going to back off from all of this.
Josh: I was. I am. Cassie chose not to look at the information that I had, and that was her choice to make, but...
Olivia: Yeah, but what?
Josh: Every time I see Cassie and Jeffrey together, I can't help but think if this information, this connection between Richard and Jeffrey-- whatever it was-- if comes out, she's going to get hurt.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Hey, you read my mind. Here. Here you go. You keep the change.
Waitress: Sir, I was taking that upstairs.

Jonathan: I'm Cassie Winslow's nephew, so get another bottle. Hey, hey. Come here. I have another favor to ask. I was walking into the garage, and I saw this black S.U.V. With its lights on, and the license plate said "Lewis 1." And isn't that Josh Lewis over there? So that's probably his.
Waitress: I'll tell him.
Jonathan: Thank you.
Waitress: Mr. Lewis, is your black S.U.V. Parked in the garage?
Josh: It's a hybrid. It is. Why, is there a problem?
Waitress: Well, someone reported that the lights are on.
Josh: Oh. Okay. Well, thank you very much. I'll be right back.
Jonathan: Hello, Auntie O. Time for a refill?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: Sit, Lizzie.
Lizzie: Oh, no. I don't want to ruin Marina's night.
Marina: Oh, please, Lizzie, won't you? The more the merrier. So, anyway, you were out with Jonathan tonight?
Tammy: At the Beacon. My mom and Jeffrey were there, too.
Lizzie: What does your mom say about the two of you?
Tammy: Well, she doesn't approve. Most people don't.
Marina: Well, who cares about most people?
Lizzie: So what's it like to be with Jonathan? I mean he is so like not Sandy.
Marina: Lizzie.
Lizzie: Well, I mean, it's true, he's not.
Tammy: Jonathan is amazing. All I can say is, you know, I just wish everyone else could see what I could see. Even he doesn't get it. He doesn't know how incredible he is.
Lizzie: You really do love him?
Tammy: Yeah, I do. He's doing everything to make sure that I'm okay and to make sure everything is okay with my family.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: That's a good year.
Olivia: I'm hoping it's going to be.
Jonathan: So where's your boss?
Olivia: My date has gone to turn his car lights off.
Jonathan: Date?
Olivia: You're not going to go run and tell your mommy?

Jonathan: Why would I do that? My mommy? I don't care, you like him, he likes you. You guys be happy, that's what I say. If he doesn't want to be in Reva's life, I don't want him there anyway. ( Laughter )
Olivia: Thank you!
Jonathan: You're welcome. My support comes with a price, though.
Olivia: Of course it does.
Jonathan: Don't get your panties all in a knot over there. A little more of the same is what I'm asking for.
Olivia: The same what?
Jonathan: Support. Tammy and me. People want to burn us at the stake. People want to burn me at the stake.
Olivia: Hey, who am I to judge?
Jonathan: I knew I could count on you. To acceptance.
Olivia: To acceptance. Acceptance.
Jonathan: Acceptance. Too bad Cassie's not more like you.
Olivia: She still giving you a hard time?
Jonathan: Uh-huh. If it was up to her, I would go away for the rest of my life, and she has the D.A. on her side.
Olivia: Sorry to hear that.
Jonathan: It's all right, I'm use to it. Besides, Cassie doesn't have the greatest taste in men anyway, does she?
Olivia: Judging by her last two choices, I'd have to agree with you.
Jonathan: Wait a second. I mean, I know Uncle Eddie was a loser, but isn't Jeffrey a good guy?

Tammy: I'd be lying if I said I'm not scared. I just don't know what I would do without him.
Marina: People were afraid and against Danny and I.
Lizzie: Yeah, and Coop and me, too.
Marina: Yeah, some people still aren't with that.
Lizzie: Anyway, we know what the feeling feels like, don't we? We'd do anything to be with them no matter what our grandfather says.
Marina: Or our dad.
Tammy: Or my mom. Yeah, anything, because if I didn't have Jonathan, I don't know what my life would be about.
Marina: I know the feeling.
Lizzie: Maybe you'll know it again one day, Marina. I know you've just made so many bad choices.
Marina: I'm seeing Alan- Michael.
Lizzie: You are so not!
Marina: Yes, I am.
Lizzie: He's old enough to be your... I mean, he's older than you.
Marina: And he's your uncle.
Lizzie: Oh, my gosh. My grandfather's going to flip.
Tammy: So, you like him?
Marina: Yeah, I think so.
Lizzie: Oh, my God.
Marina: I mean, I don't know. It's not anything serious. Lizzie. And even if it were...
Lizzie: I know, I know. It's none of my business.
Marina: I could be your aunt.
Tammy: To the wrong guy.
Lizzie: To the wrong guy.
Marina: To the wrong guy.

Mallet: Sorry about what I said before. I shouldn't have said that.
Harley: You shouldn't have; I shouldn't have.
Mallet: Why don't I drive you back into town?
Harley: No, I need to stay here.
Mallet: Gus isn't here.
Harley: Well, he's out there somewhere.
Mallet: Yeah, I know, but Cooper, come on.
Harley: You know, you don't want to help, just go back to the hotel.
Frank: Okay, if there was anything out there, it's now covered by the snow, so...
Ed: Mrs. Aitoro, we'll talk back at your motel?
Harley: No, we can talk here. You're not leaving Gus.
Frank: Sis, the weather is turning bad...
Ed: I'm sorry. Chief Cooper, we'll meet you back at the car.
Frank: Okay.
Harley: You're just going to let him walk away?
Frank: Look, I don't have a choice here. They're expecting another ice storm to hit this area.
Harley: I don't care. We should be doing something!
Mallet: Frank's right. The roads are covered in ice. We've got to get back while we still have a chance.
Harley: Then you guys go back. Go back, I don't care, I'm not leaving him.
Frank: Harley, come on!
Harley: Frank! Leave me alone.
Gus: What are you doing?
Harley: Gus...
Gus: No, no. Don't be silly. Don't be silly.
Harley: Well, somebody has to find you.
Gus: Well it certainly isn't going to be you-- not tonight.
Harley: You could die out here.
Gus: Anybody could die out here.
Harley: I'm not a quitter.

Gus: There's a lot of bad weather coming, okay? Now, I didn't drive off in that car with Alan so you could throw your life away looking for me. You've got to go home. Go home with the kids. Don't worry, I'm coming back to you, no matter what.
Mallet: Harley!
Harley: Gus...
Gus: No matter what.
Mallet: Hey, Harley. Harley, let's go to the car. Come on. Do you want me to carry you?
Harley: No. Let's go. I'm done here.

Gina Tognoni, inside "The Light." What I enjoy most about playing Dinah is that she has so much diversity as far as a character. The right guy for Dinah, that's like the million-dollar question: I think it's definitely Mallet. Why? Because Mallet is probably one of the first emotionally available men she has ever run into. See Dinah, Wednesday, January 18, on "the light."
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: Hey.
Harley: Hi, Daddy.
Buzz: No new news?
Harley: No. That's okay. We didn't find him today, but we'll find him tomorrow or the next day. Where are the boys?
Buzz: They've been asleep for about an hour. If you want I can wake them up.
Harley: No. That's okay; they need their sleep.
Frank: Yeah, well, somebody else needs her sleep, too. So why don't you go up to bed and when the boys wake up, I'll have them come and wake you up, all right?
Harley: That sounds really good, except I just want to put something on my leg because it really hurts.
Buzz: Huh? Oh, how did you do that?
Harley: I fell on a rock. It doesn't matter. I'm kind of hungry.
Buzz: Okay, I've got to get a first aid kit.
Ava: No, no, I'll get it. I'll get it.
Buzz: It's down by the oven on the left.
Ava: Okay.
Buzz: Okay? All right. What do you want to eat, honey?
Harley: I'm not sure. Can you give me the phone?
Buzz: Who do you want to call?
Harley: Alan-Michael and Dinah. See how their day at the office went.
Buzz: Oh, they can wait.
Harley: Well, I have responsibilities, Daddy. I can't let my whole life just fall apart.
Buzz: Oh, it'll keep. Your life isn't going to fall apart. We'll see to that.
Harley: Thank you.
Buzz: You must be worried sick. I mean, hearing about the car and...
Harley: The only thing that the car told us is that Gus and Alan weren't in it.
Buzz: What about that guy?
Harley: You can't put much faith into what somebody like that has to say. Don't look at me like that. I'm fine.
Buzz: Are you?
Harley: I will be, once he gets home.
Frank: Oh, man. Hey, listen. Thanks for backing me up out there, man. I didn't think she was going to budge. Want some more coffee?
Mallet: Yeah, hit me. Yeah, that surprised me, too. Listen, Frank, I understand why the feds don't want Harley involved, but I don't understand...
Frank: Guess what? We're not going to be involved either.
Mallet: Frank, he's your brother-in-law it's family. How can you not get involved? I don't get that.
Frank: Because the feds are on top of their game. They have more resources than we do. And, besides, anyway, it's out of our jurisdiction now. What?
Mallet: Then I'll have to do it as a civilian.

Quinn: Hey, how are you, fella?
Coop: I've had better days. What do you want?
Quinn: I'm just here to pick up an order, a buzz burger with mushrooms. I try to only eat only organic stuff...
Coop: Whatever, okay. I'll just go check on that for you.
Quinn: Listen, I thought Lizzie might be here.
Coop: No, she's not. But I will tell her you said hello.
Quinn: Don't worry about it. I'm sure I'll see her later.

Lizzie: Well, I don't know about the two of you, but what Coop and I have is going to last.
Marina: Oh, my God, you could be my aunt.
Lizzie: With any luck.
Tammy: Talk about keeping it in the family.
Marina: This town is too small.
Lizzie: Talk about undervalued real estate market. That's my big news. I just got my own place, and I got it for a steal.
Marina: I already knew that.
Lizzie: Yeah, well, Tammy didn't.
Tammy: Well, that's great, Lizzie. You must be doing really well.
Lizzie: I know. Even better, I'm going to ask Coop to move in with me. ( Cell phone rings ) Oh. I should get that. Just one second. Hey. Yeah, I was just talking about you, sort of.
Quinn: Great. Lizzie, I need to see you right now.
Lizzie: I'm with friends.
Quinn: I don't care. Say bye-bye.
Lizzie: I can't.
Quinn: Okay, but don't say I didn't warn you.

Lizzie: What?

Lizzie: Okay, stay right where you are. I'll be right there, okay? Where are you?
Quinn: This charming little family place called Company.
Lizzie: Okay, good, I was on my way there anyway. Okay, see you in a few.
Quinn: Super. See you then.
Lizzie: Hey. I loved this. We'll have to do this again some other time. I've had a lot of fun, but I've got to go. Bye. Bye. See ya.
Marina: Okay, so what was that about?
Tammy: Who knows?
Marina: Well, I guess she kind of behaved herself tonight.
Tammy: Yeah, she can. I guess that's why I never completely wrote her off.
Marina: Lizzie could be my aunt. Oh, my gosh. You want another hot chocolate or a drink?
Tammy: Actually, I need to go back to Reva's.

Olivia: Let's talk about happy things.

Josh: Well, that was a complete waste of time. Hello, Jonathan.

Jonathan: Nope. I can stay and have a drink with you guys. What are we having?

Jonathan: You kids have fun. I'll be here when you get back.
Josh: Please don't be.
Jonathan: Hello, Tammy. Mom wants me out of your life, but maybe with Josh here, I can help her change her mind.
